headline: Experience in Motilal, I had worked in the organization for 6 months here is some insight on my experience,
pros:
Since I was in retail client reactivation it was a front-end job so it was all about client interaction and generating brokerage.

The training for calls and the pressure environment can help in improving the communication skill also make you very comfortable in the front end calling and in making conversation.

Since you would be pitching a lot of stocks and financial instruments you will get a very good insight on the overall market and how the financial market dealing happens. Along with that, you would learn a lot about the fundamental of the company which will be helpful in the future.
cons:
A lot of things would depend on your team if you are part of a good team and it has good data set you will be able to perform otherwise you won’t able to perform or generate revenue. If there is no revenue you would have no incentive this would not be good as the basic pay will be very low.

There won’t be any work-life balance you would be working almost 12Hrs a day which can impact your mental health. If your targets are not then also you would have to sit back for more work

The work environment and the surrounding can become a little toxic as most people will be overworking which can lead to a lot of negativity

headline: Nightmare for freshers
pros:
- Top class facilities in head office (but toilets very unhygienic with cockroaches in it).
- Canteen in head office.
- Coffee machine also available in each floor of head office.
cons:
- Caste based politics.
- Favouritism.
- HR policies and processes are the worst. They're team is the worst team you'll know of. They're not bothered about employees and their satisfaction.
- Disorganised team heads with attitude and ego problems.
- You dont really get the job you have been told of in the interview. HR will not explain you the responsibilities or job role at all, before joining!
- Highest qualified persons recruited at the lowest pay imaginable.
- Nearly impossible for freshers to work. Very High employee turnover rate, mainly among freshers.
- They never follow their own values stated. It is all fake marketing.
- Only those who lick the bosses feet at all times are favored and benefited.

headline: Nice place to work at if you can forget everything and achieve your targets
pros:
Relaxed work culture
Fun friday - games are played for two hours every friday
Almost an 1 hour 15 minutes break in the whole day
great place to enhance knowledge
cons:
work from 8:30 am to 6pm or more depending on how you meet your targets
force yourself as well as the customer to do something they are not interested in.
less time for personal commitments like studies, family time
sometimes saturday you get off and sometimes you dont, again depending on targets.
no allowances, less salary and you end up spending most of your time and salary

headline: Terrible place to work. Negative work life balance.
pros:
Building looks fancy from the outside
If you can work here, you can work anywhere.
cons:
1. Negative work life balance. Management expects you to work from 8-10 everyday and the more you do, the more work you get. 
2. Pay: pay is less than the market and moreover the increments don't beat the inflation rate. 
3. Performance management: Depends on how well you can suck up to your boss and the seniors 
4.  Stupid processes: from joining till leaving, you will get the worst processes, almost everyone here is frustrated. 
5.They have a gym, library etc. Which you get no time to use, the cafeteria is veg only. 

Can go on and on..
